intro: Pauletia membranacea, commonly known as the membranous pauletia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, papery leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
